intro: Cypselodontia eckloniana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant is known for its vibrant colors and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Cypselodontia eckloniana is also valued for its ability to bloom year-round under proper care.
